channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold and Inflation: An Unstable Relationship
item.description: While there are periods when gold has hedged inflation quite well, beware blanket claims of gold's inflation-hedging utility.

item.title: IRS says it will refund taxes extracted from Ohioans who got financial assistance after Norfolk Southern derailment disaster
item.description: “I don’t know why they didn’t do that from the very beginning,” East Palestine resident Misti Allison said.

item.title: Monetary Policy and Financial Conditions: Meaningful Relationship?
item.description: An analysis of the Fed's recent rounds of quantitative tightening (QT) and quantitative easing (QE) yields actionable insights about the relationship between monetary policy and financial conditions.

item.title: Zero percent down mortgages might help more first-time homebuyers break into the housing market—but there are caveats
item.description: United Wholesale Mortgage announced a 0% down program last month, and since then it’s been all the rage, but people are split: Does it eliminate a barrier or will it launch us into another subprime mortgage crisis?

item.title: Five Quotes from Financial History to Guide Trustees
item.description: If you serve as a trustee of an institutional investment plan, these five quotes may help guide your decisions for the benefit of those who depend on your stewardship.

item.title: Kansas politicians relaunch effort to steal Kansas City Chiefs from neighboring Missouri after a $1 billion taxpayer-funded plan fizzled
item.description: After an earlier stadium-financing plan fell through, Kansas legislators are trying a new tactic to bring the Chiefs across the state border.

item.title: Stocks for the Long Run? Setting the Record Straight
item.description: Stocks are a good investment long-term, providing that you dial in your expectations. New historical findings provide a richer, more complete understanding of international returns.

item.title: Short seller Scorpion Capital accuses Japan’s most actively traded company of being the ‘largest outright fraud in the world’
item.description: Hedge fund targets niche semiconductor company that’s rode AI demand for huge gains since 2019.

item.title: Rethinking Retirement Planning Amidst Aging Demographic Frontiers
item.description: Forward-thinking approaches to policy and wealth management are needed to ensure a better financial future across generations and income brackets.

item.title: New York governor abruptly cancels nation's first 'congestion pricing' system that would have charged $15 to drive into midtown Manhattan
item.description: The $15 charge "can break the budget of a hardworking or middle class household," Kathy Hochul said.
